required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: D-dimer Adjusted Versus Therapeutic Dose Low-molecular-weight Heparin in Patients With COVID-19 Pneumonia
clinical_study.official_title: D-dimer Adjusted Versus Therapeutic Dose Low-molecular-weight Heparin in Patients With COVID-19 Pneumonia

brief_summary.textblock: evaluation of the efficacy and safety of D-dimer adjusted heparin versus therapeutic dose heparin in patients with COVID-19 Pneumonia.

detailed_description.textblock:
The following will be done for enrolled patients:
1. Data collection: name, age, sex, special habits of medical importance (i.e. smoking, drug abuse), comorbid conditions.
2. Clinical examination Vital data Local chest examination
3. Measurement of oxygen saturation using pulse oximeter
4. Laboratory investigations:
Complete blood count with differential count Liver and kidney functions D-dimer level Coagulation profile
5. Radiology work up ( Chest X-ray-High resolution computed tomography of the chest- computed tomography of the chest with pulmonary angiography as needed)
6. Sepsis-induced coagulopathy score (SIC score)
7. Sequential organ failure score (SOFA score)
8. Patients will receive treatment according to the hospital guidelines for different disease stratification severity

primary_outcome.time_frame: Until patient is discharged or up to 4 weeks whichever comes first

primary_outcome.measure: occurrence of venous and/or arterial thrombosis
primary_outcome.time_frame: Until patient is discharged or up to 4 weeks whichever comes first
primary_outcome.description: clinical signs supported by radiological evidence of arterial thrombosis or venous thromboembolism (e.g. venous or arterial duplex and CT scan of the chest with pulmonary angiography)

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Until patient is discharged or up to 4 weeks whichever comes first
secondary_outcome.description: calculation of sepsis induced coagulopathy (SIC) score

secondary_outcome.measure: Occurrence of adult respiratory distress syndrome (ARDS)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Until patient is discharged or up to 4 weeks whichever comes first
secondary_outcome.description: Calculation of partial pressure of arterial oxygen/ fraction of inspired oxygen (PaO2/ FIO2) ratio

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Until patient is discharged or up to 4 weeks whichever comes first
secondary_outcome.description: Calculation of sequential organ failure (SOFA) score

secondary_outcome.measure: ICU admission and need for mechanical ventilation
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Until patient is discharged or up to 4 weeks whichever comes first
secondary_outcome.description: occurrence of respiratory failure detected by arterial blood gases analysis

arm_group.description: Therapeutic dose low-molecular-weight heparin from admission until the end of hospital stay Enoxaparin 1 mg/kg subcutaneous every 12 hours

arm_group.arm_group_label: D-dimer levels and weight adjusted low-molecular-weight heparin (LMWH)therapy
arm_group.description: from admission until the end of hospital stay. Patients will be stratified according to their body weight and D-dimer level and receive LMWH D-Dimer level Body Weight LMWH dose <1 mg/dl <100kg Enoxaparin 40mg OD 100-150kg Enoxaparin 40mg BD >150kg Enoxaparin 60mg BD 1-3 mg/ dl <100kg Enoxaparin 40mg BD 100-150kg Enoxaparin 80mg BD >150kg Enoxaparin 120mg BD >3 mg/ dl Enoxaparin 80mg BD

intervention.description: low-molecular-weight heparin administered via subcutaneous injection
intervention.arm_group_label: D-dimer levels and weight adjusted low-molecular-weight heparin (LMWH)therapy

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- All adult (>18 years) patients from both sexes with COVID-19 pneumonia with positive nucleic acid test for severe acute respiratory syndrome Coronavirus (SARS-CoV-2) hospitalized either in the ward or intensive care unit
Exclusion Criteria:
- Patients with absolute contraindication of pharmacological thromboprophylaxis and/ anticoagulation
- Congenital hemorrhagic disorders
- Hypersensitivity to heparin
- Personal history of heparin-induced thrombocytopenia
- Active major bleeding or conditions predisposing to major bleeding. Major bleeding is defined as fulfilling any one of these three criteria: a) occurs in a critical area or organ (e.g.intracranial, intraspinal, intraocular, retroperitoneal, intra-articular or pericardial, intra-uterine or intramuscular with compartment syndrome), b) causes a fall in haemoglobin level (Hb) of ≥2g/dL in a 24h period, or c) leads to transfusion of 2 or more units of whole blood or red blood cells (13).
- Suspected or confirmed bacterial endocarditis
- Ongoing or planned therapeutic anticoagulation for any other indication
- Platelet count <50,000/μL within the past 24 hours or Hb level <8g/dL
- Prothrombin time (PT) ≥2 seconds above the upper limit of age-appropriate local reference range within the past 24 hours
- Activated partial thromboplastin time (aPTT) ≥4 seconds above the upper limit of age-appropriate local reference range within the past 24 hours
- Fibrinogen <2.0 g/L
- Severe renal impairment (CrCl<30 mL/min) or acute kidney injury
- Use of dual antiplatelet therapy
- Pregnancy
- Unwillingness to consent
